title: 109_hr377
content: The Act may be cited as the "Honoring Every Requirement of Exemplary Service Act of 2005" or the "HEROES Act of 2005". Death gratuity enhancements are included in the Act. The "HEROES Act of 2005" includes death gratuity enhancements, increasing the death gratuity to $100,000 for deaths resulting from combat-related causes or causes incurred in designated operations or areas. The death gratuity payable under the "HEROES Act of 2005" is $100,000 for deaths resulting from combat-related causes or causes incurred in designated operations or areas. The death gratuity amount is increased for deaths related to combat causes or designated operations/areas, as specified by the Secretary of Defense. The death gratuity amount is amended to include adjustments under subsections (a) and (c), with additional gratuity requirements for deaths before the effective date. The death gratuity amount is amended by striking and inserting adjustments under subsections (a) and (d). Additional gratuity is required for deaths before the effective date. The Secretary of the military department shall pay a death gratuity to members of the Armed Forces who died before the enactment of the Act as a direct result of wounds, injuries, or illnesses. The death gratuity is paid to members of the Armed Forces who died before the enactment of the Act as a direct result of wounds, injuries, or illnesses incurred in specific operations or as described in the United States Code. The additional death gratuity of $238,000 is provided to beneficiaries of military personnel who incurred illnesses in specific operations or as described in the United States Code after October 7, 2001. The additional death gratuity of $238,000 is payable to beneficiaries entitled under section 1477 of title 10, United States Code, in cases of military personnel's death after October 7, 2001. If there are multiple beneficiaries, they will share the gratuity amount accordingly. The additional death gratuity is payable to beneficiaries entitled under section 1477 of title 10, United States Code, in cases of military personnel's death after October 7, 2001. If there are multiple beneficiaries, they will share the gratuity amount accordingly based on their share of the regular military death gratuity. The additional death gratuity amount for multiple beneficiaries is determined based on their share of the regular military death gratuity. Definitions for "additional death gratuity" and "regular military death gratuity" are provided in this subsection. The additional death gratuity amount for multiple beneficiaries is determined based on their share of the regular military death gratuity. Definitions for "additional death gratuity" and "regular military death gratuity" are provided in this subsection. SEC. 3. SERVICEMEMBERS' GROUP LIFE INSURANCE ENHANCEMENTS. Increased maximum amount under Servicemembers' Group Life Insurance to $400,000 or lesser amount chosen by member, with additional coverage for certain members. The maximum amount under Servicemembers' Group Life Insurance has been increased to $400,000 or a lesser amount chosen by the member, with additional coverage for certain members. The maximum amount under Servicemembers' Group Life Insurance has been increased to $400,000, with additional coverage for certain members in specific areas or operations. The maximum amount for Servicemembers' Group Life Insurance has been raised to $400,000, with added coverage for members in designated areas or operations who suffer injuries or illnesses resulting in death. The new subsection (e) specifies that a member covered is one who dies from wounds, injuries, or illnesses incurred while serving in a designated combat operation or zone. The Secretary designates combat operations or zones for this subsection. Members who die from injuries or illnesses incurred while serving in designated areas are eligible for $150,000 in insurance. The additional amount of insurance provided for a member under this subchapter is $150,000, but may be reduced if the member's elected amount exceeds $250,000 to comply with limitations. Total insurance payable for a member is determined under this subchapter. The insurance coverage for a member under this subchapter is limited to $400,000. If the elected amount exceeds $250,000, the additional insurance will be reduced to comply with the limitation. During service in designated operations, the cost of $150,000 insurance coverage is contributed as specified and cannot be deducted from the member's pay. During designated operations, the cost of $150,000 insurance coverage for a member under this subchapter is contributed as specified and cannot be deducted from the member's pay. For designated operations, the cost of Servicemembers' Group Life Insurance is contributed from the appropriation for active duty pay, determined by the Secretary. The cost of Servicemembers' Group Life Insurance for designated operations is contributed from the appropriation for active duty pay, determined by the Secretary. Amendments are made to sections 1967 and 1977 of the title. Amendments are made to sections 1967 and 1977 of the title regarding insurance coverage amounts for members, including coordination with VGLI. Amendments to sections 1967 and 1977 of the title increase insurance coverage amounts for members and include coordination with VGLI. Additional insurance provided under section 1967(e) cannot be counted towards Veterans' Group Life Insurance issuance. Members are required to make elections to reduce or decline insurance coverage. Amendments to section 1967 of the title require members to make elections regarding insurance coverage, including notifying their spouse of any decision to not be insured or to have coverage less than the maximum amount allowed. Amendments to section 1967 of the title require members to make elections regarding insurance coverage, including notifying their spouse of any decision to not be insured or to have coverage less than the maximum amount allowed. The regulations prescribed by the Secretary of Defense state that notice of such election must be provided to the spouse of the member. Additionally, a member with a spouse may not elect to not be insured under the subchapter. Amendments to section 1967 of the title require members to make elections regarding insurance coverage, including notifying their spouse of any decision to not be insured or to have coverage less than the maximum amount allowed. A member with a spouse may not elect not to be insured under this subchapter without the written consent of the spouse. The section mandates that a member with a spouse cannot change beneficiaries without spousal consent. The effective date for this provision is set to be more than 90 days after the enactment of the Act.
